meanings.definition: To be fitting or appropriate for someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Wearing a crown would beseem a king.
meanings.sent2: Formal attire would beseem a job interview.
meanings.sent3: It would not beseem a clown to wear a tuxedo to a circus.
meanings.sent4: The extravagant decorations beseem a royal palace.
meanings.sent5: The grandeur of the ballroom beseems a royal celebration.

meanings.definition: To be suitable or proper for a particular situation.
meanings.sent1: A warm coat would beseem the cold weather.
meanings.sent2: A loud party would not beseem a library.
meanings.sent3: It would not beseem a beach party to have a snowman as a guest.
meanings.sent4: The bright colors beseem a festive occasion.
meanings.sent5: The elegant decor beseems a formal dinner party.
